main_text:
Objections to Frankfurt-Style Cases
4. Objections to Frankfurt-Style Cases

Not everyone is impressed by Frankfurt’s proposed
counterexamples and the FSCs he inspired. Some critics concede that
PAP is false, but insist that some neighboring principle—one
that will serve many of the same purposes as PAP—is immune to
Frankfurt’s examples. Others attack FSCs directly, arguing that
the examples fail to show even that PAP is false. The critical
literature is too large to cover in detail here, but this section
outlines a few broad themes. (Among the many useful surveys are
Fischer 1999, 2011; Sartorio 2017; and the pertinent chapters of
Beebee 2013; Griffith 2013; Timpe 2013.)
entry_title: Moral Responsibility and the Principle of Alternative Possibilities
